blocks.title: Intro to Coding for Designers: Six Week Workshop
blocks.generated_title: Intro to Coding for Designers: Six Week Workshop
blocks.description_html: Intro to Coding for Designers is an entry-level class that teaches designers the fundamentals of HTML, CSS and Javascript. The class covers a series of experiments that demonstrate conceptual knowledge of code, designed to give students the tools to apply them to future web projects.
blocks.description: Intro to Coding for Designers is an entry-level class that teaches designers the fundamentals of HTML, CSS and Javascript. The class covers a series of experiments that demonstrate conceptual knowledge of code, designed to give students the tools to apply them to future web projects.

blocks.title: Pace Layering: How Complex Systems Learn and Keep Learning
blocks.generated_title: Pace Layering: How Complex Systems Learn and Keep Learning
blocks.description_html: Pace layers provide many-leveled corrective, stabilizing feedback throughout the system. It is in the contradictions between these layers that civilization finds its surest health. I propose six significant levels of pace and size in a robust and adaptable civilization.
blocks.description: Pace layers provide many-leveled corrective, stabilizing feedback throughout the system. It is in the contradictions between these layers that civilization finds its surest health. I propose six significant levels of pace and size in a robust and adaptable civilization.

source.title: Pace Layering: How Complex Systems Learn and Keep Learning

blocks.title: A CRITICAL FIELD GUIDE FOR WORKING WITH MACHINE LEARNING DATASETS
blocks.generated_title: A CRITICAL FIELD GUIDE FOR WORKING WITH MACHINE LEARNING DATASETS
blocks.description_html: Maybe you’re an engineer creating a new machine vision system to track birds. You might be a journalist using social media data to research Costa Rican households. You could be a researcher who stumbled upon your university’s archive of handwritten census cards from 1939. Or a designer creating a chatbot that relies on large language models like GPT-3. Perhaps you’re an artist experimenting with visual style combinations using DALLE-2. Or maybe you’re an activist with an urgent story that needs telling, and you’re searching for the right dataset to tell it.
blocks.description: Maybe you’re an engineer creating a new machine vision system to track birds. You might be a journalist using social media data to research Costa Rican households. You could be a researcher who stumbled upon your university’s archive of handwritten census cards from 1939. Or a designer creating a chatbot that relies on large language models like GPT-3. Perhaps you’re an artist experimenting with visual style combinations using DALLE-2. Or maybe you’re an activist with an urgent story that needs telling, and you’re searching for the right dataset to tell it.

source.title: A CRITICAL FIELD GUIDE FOR WORKING WITH MACHINE LEARNING DATASETS

blocks.title: A creative person's guide to feeling healthy
blocks.generated_title: A creative person's guide to feeling healthy
blocks.description_html: Our two brain hemispheres play inherently different roles when it comes to our state of mind: the right hemisphere is predominantly active during mindsets of creativity, intuition, and imagination, while the left side fires up during tasks of logic, decision making, and analytical thinking.
